description: A comforting and nutritious casserole packed with a variety of colorful vegetables, baked in a creamy sauce and topped with a golden crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine the broccoli florets, sliced carrots, green beans, and corn kernels.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup and milk.
Pour the soup mixture over the vegetables. Add 1 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper. Stir gently to combine.
Pour the vegetable mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the casserole is bubbly.
Remove from oven. Sprinkle the remaining 0.5 cup of cheddar cheese over the top. If using breadcrumbs, toss them with melted butter and sprinkle over the cheese.
Return to the oven and bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and golden brown, and the topping is crispy.
Let stand for a few minutes before serving.
